Class ApplicationConfig

java.lang.Object
jeroenflvr.csvprocessor.config.ApplicationConfig
public class ApplicationConfig extends Object
Immutable configuration holder for the CSV processor application.

This class encapsulates all application-specific configuration including Kafka topic names, application identifiers, and processing behavior settings. It provides a type-safe way to access configuration values throughout the application.

Configuration values are typically loaded from environment variables through the fromEnvironment() factory method, which provides sensible defaults for local development while allowing production customization.

Since:
1.0.0
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
JeroenFL

  • Constructor Details

    • ApplicationConfig

      public ApplicationConfig(String inputTopic, String outputTopic, String updateTopic, String stateTopic, String applicationId, boolean emitSnapshotOnBootstrap)
      Constructs a new ApplicationConfig with the specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      inputTopic - the Kafka topic to read file paths from
      outputTopic - the Kafka topic to write all processed records to
      updateTopic - the Kafka topic to write only changed records to
      stateTopic - the Kafka topic used for state management
      applicationId - the unique identifier for this Kafka Streams application
      emitSnapshotOnBootstrap - whether to emit all records on application startup

  • Method Details

    • fromEnvironment

      public static ApplicationConfig fromEnvironment()
      Creates an ApplicationConfig instance from environment variables.

      This factory method reads configuration from environment variables and provides sensible defaults for local development. The following environment variables are consulted:

      • INPUT_TOPIC - defaults to "local-input-topic"
      • OUTPUT_TOPIC - defaults to "local-stream-topic"
      • UPDATE_TOPIC - defaults to "local-updates-only-topic"
      • STATE_TOPIC - defaults to "local-state-topic"
      • APP_ID - defaults to "cos-csv-expander-app"
      Returns:
      a new ApplicationConfig instance with values from environment or defaults
      See Also:
      • EnvironmentUtils.envOrProp(String, String)

    • getInputTopic

    • isEmitSnapshotOnBootstrap

      public boolean isEmitSnapshotOnBootstrap()
      Determines whether to emit all records on application bootstrap.
      Returns:
      true if snapshot emission is enabled on bootstrap
